JavaFy OCA/OCP
Simple :
► Java is a Simple Language with syntax similar to C++ so its easy to learn.
Object Oriented :
► Java is a truly object oriented language. All programs in java are managed with Objects and Classes.
Robust :
► Java programs are robust in nature as java provides automatic garbage collection for unused objects and also provides proper exception handling which inturn prevents system from crashing.
► To achieve high reliability java check the code at compile time as well as runtime.
Platform Independent :
► Java programs are platform independent i.e. they can be executed from different environments.
► Java achieves architecture neutrality because java compiler produces an interemediate code known as bytecode for a machine which does not exist.
► The virtual machine is known as Java Virtual Machine and this exists in computers memory.
Compiled and Interpreted :

► Java is both compiled and interpreted. In the first stage the compiler translates source code into bytecode. In the second stage, java interpreter generates machine code from bytecode which can be run on different machines
Multithreaded :
► Java supports multithreading allowing tasks to be run simultaneously. This makes it easier to finish multiple tasks at the same time without waiting for one to finish.
High Performance :
► Java uses JIT compiler (Just In Time) which is built in JVM. JIT compiler reads bytecodes into sections and compiles into machine language faster thus high performance is obtained.
Secure :
► JVM observes what the program is doing and can prevent suspicious actions thus making the system secure.
Distributed :

► Java is designed for distributed environment as it handles TCP/IP protocols. Java applications can access remote procedures and objects on the internet enabling sharing of data and programs on the internet
Dynamic :
► Java is a dynamic language i.e. capable of linking new classes, libraries, methods and objects on the fly. This is dependent on runtime queries and responses of users.
► Java Environment includes a large no. of development tools which are a part of Java Development Kit (JDK).
► Java Environment also includes classes and methods that are a part of Java Standard Library also known as Application Programming Interface or API.
